column4: anyone know how to force umount for cdrom? I'm typing sudo umount /media/cdrom0 and it says device is busy ?
lsof |grep -i cdrom0   will show you what's using it
have you pressed the button the cdrom drive that ejects the cdrom?
and it's not mounted, you're sure?
look at dmesg i guess
it could be
type 'mount'
and pastebin the results
i dont' know what that means
eject /dev/hdc
np
md5sum generates a long magical number off a file
if the file is at all different, the long magical number will have changed
so if you take an md5sum of, say, a cd-ISO, and compare it to what it's supposed to be, if it's different, than the contents of the .iso have changed
detecting bad downloads/verifying a hacker hasn't changed it, etc
the md5 file is just a number you compare it to, type "man md5sum" for more information
if you want to find the md5sum of every file in your system (note: no reason to do this), you'd type: find . |xargs -n1 md5sum
hehe
naa, you don't need to worry about it
you can safely ignore the existance of .md5 files
yeap, the md5 is just a file with a long number in it, it's very small, go ahead and download it/open it up with a text editor if you wanna see it
once you download the real file, run "md5sum <downloadedfile>" and compare the numbers, they should be identical to what's shown in the *.md5 file
sudo uses your own users password
su uses root's password, which, default in ubuntu, is not set, so therefore it is impossible
